welcometext.welcome: Welcome to the Murdoch IT Society!
welcometext.desc: We are a student collective formed to pool all our knowledge into one single forum to help better our prospective, current and alumni students. We provide a platform for our students to discuss their work with academic integrity, boost employability and host events.

about.title: About us
about.desc: As the only generalist IT club at Murdoch University, the Murdoch IT Society is comprised of students from a wide range of subdisciplines within the field of technology. We pride ourselves in offering an academic environment for such diverse, yet like-minded individuals to share, collaborate, and assist each other in our personal projects and studies. At present, this environment is largely delivered through the utilisation of a Discord server – though we are working hard to shape MITS into a dynamic and welcoming on-campus presence.
about.descCont: During the growth of our community, our Discord server has developed an atmosphere that provides a supportive, fun, and vibrant location to engage with your fellow students at Murdoch.
about.discord: Join our Discord today to see what MITS has to offer.

committee.title: Meet the Committee
committee.desc: Our Committee members keep MITS ticking, responsible for community management, event organisation and idea realisation

pres.title: President
pres.name: James Morgan
pres.desc: I am a motivated, innovative Software Developer with a love for problem solving and constant learning. I have a particular interest in writing efficient, optimised code.

vp.title: Vice President
vp.name: Rachael Stevenson
vp.desc: I am a second year Cyber Sec/Internetworking student with a passion for all things IoT. I believe team work makes the dream work and we’d be lost without the help of our dedicated committee.

sec.title: Secretary
sec.name: Jean Iwanyk
sec.desc: I am a Cyber Security and Internetworking graduate who is currently undertaking Doctoral studies in transformative education practices through the use of IT as a pillar for student engagement within Western Australian classrooms. Outside of technologies, I enjoy trying to write my second thesis, a cook book!

tres.title: Treasurer
tres.name: Marco Garzon Lara
tres.desc: I’m a Computer Science student passionate for building and engineering software. I also have other tech-related interests such as computer hardware, and building PCs.
